info: The program cluster aims to support the Government in two main ways. First, it seeks to expand the private sector through institutional development for SME policy and access to finance, a better investment climate, improved trade policy and capacity, and stable macroeconomic environment. Second, the program clusters aims to help reduce poverty and increase jobs through an expansion of the private sector. Subprogram 1 of the program cluster, financed with a grant of $5 million from ADB’s Special Funds resources, focuses on legislative reforms to the enterprise registration regime and begins the process for SME policy and institutional strengthening, while also targeting trade policy reforms. It will establish the basis for continual policy dialogue and engagement during 2007–2009 (subprogram 2).
name: PRIVATE SECTOR & SME ENTERPRISE DEV'T PROGRAM CLUS
